channel.title: HUGE problem with VPS?
channel.description:
Hi guys,
This topic calls for someone with extreme knowledge in this matter. Also, if this is posted in the wrong section, can a Moderator please move it?
Last night I purchased a basic plan of VPS from Optic VPS for my Private Server. I cannot find ANYTHING that will help me upload my files to the Dedicated. There is no software or program included. [b]Below is a picture of the only real thing I see. Can someone PLEASE help me, I have sent in 2 support tickets, and have gotten no response...[/b]
[URL=http://img696.imageshack.us/i/98427898.jpg/][IMG]http://img696.imageshack.us/img696/6614/98427898.jpg[/img][/URL]
Thanks, Situations

item.title: HUGE problem with VPS?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

To be honest, just get a linux VPS. If you choose to have a remote desktop connection then you can simply download the desktop environment of your preference, configure a VNC server (or whatever the alternative is) and you are good to go. I do suggest having at least 256MB RAM though, else controlling the desktop remotely will be slow.

If you don’t want to setup a desktop manager, you can simply access all your files through SCP, as c|p stated, and to perform all necessary configurations, you can use SSH.

Read full topic

item.title: HUGE problem with VPS?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

refund? more like opportunity to learn on a machine thats easy to fix when you screw up

Read full topic

item.title: HUGE problem with VPS?
item.dc:creator: @chri5 chri5
item.description:
@chri5 wrote:

You should have received an IP, and the root password in a welcome email.

If it’s a Linux VPS (I mean, who buys windows VPS’?) then the only thing that is setup is an SSH server (in most cases). If you don’t know lunux commands etc, get a refund.

Read full topic

item.title: HUGE problem with VPS?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“c|p, post:11, topic:320948”][quote author=shangtsung1 link=topic=417412.msg3074539#msg3074539 date=1261725328]
setup a ftp server on it.
[/quote]

negative.
SCP (SCP/SFTP over SSH) is a much better (and more secure) solution than setting up an FTP server.

But then again if it is a Windows VPS (probably is, seeing as OP is likely a moron), then you really don’t have any other option (that I’m aware of), unless you setup some sort of networked FS (or rsync?)[/quote]
There’s SSHd for Windows iirc.

Read full topic

item.title: HUGE problem with VPS?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Cheese_Police, post:4, topic:320948”][quote author=atrox_ link=topic=417412.msg3069038#msg3069038 date=1261420333]
must be a flaw in the api
[/quote]

PEBKAC[/quote]Wow, well played haha.

With a VPS, you’re basically starting with “your own computer” with a clean install of Windows Server or a Linux distro. This means you must install all of the software yourself as well as configure it. You will be connecting to your VPS using SSH. Clients such as PUTTY can be used.

Read full topic
